item.title: The First Descendant: How To Upgrade Modules
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Upgrade Modules In The First Descendant
  • Which Modules To Upgrade In The First Descendant

The First Descendant is filled with sub-mechanics to be aware of and to stay on top of. Players will come across many different modules in the game. Out of all the modules in the game, players will need to know which will be the best picks for the characters they prefer — and not use up their important resources in upgrading the wrong ones.

It is best to save resources for modules players know they will be using in the end game, and only upgrading those while progressing through the story, which is why it is a good idea to find a good build guide first.

How To Upgrade Modules In The First Descendant

Players will first need to head to Albion . Albion has 2 fast travel points, with one being the dedicated option when logging into the game. Players will first need to open their map and zoom out to see the second fast travel point, located in the bottom left of the map. Once here, players need to run straight and make a left turn before the wall so they can get to Silion . This NPC will allow players to Enhance Modules, Dismantle Modules, and Combine Modules.

Players will be able to Enhance their modules by paying a cost of both gold and Kuiper . Enhancing modules will also raise the Capacity Cost, so players will need to increase their Max Capacity .

Use Energy Activators to increase the maximum number of modules on weapons and characters.

Players will come across numerous duplicate modules in the game, but they cannot have multiple of the same module on the same weapon or character. This is where Dismantling Modules will come in handy. Dismantling Modules is one of the ways players will be able to see a consistent flow of Kuiper, one of the resources they will need a lot of in The First Descendant . Combine Modules lets players select 4 modules they do not want in the hopes of getting something they do want, but dismantling for Kuiper is a great way to always know you are getting something you will be using later in the game.

Which Modules To Upgrade In The First Descendant

Players will find many modules that are viable for any and all missions, such as those that boost their weapon’s attack damage — like the Action and Reaction rare module. These modules are a great choice for casual players to upgrade at any point in the game as they will help them progress much faster. However, players that are more savvy should save up all of their resources until they know exactly which character they will be using for end-game activities.

They should then pull up a dedicated guide for that character to see which modules they should get for that character, and then invest their resources in upgrading those specific build modules.

Players will want to have modules that can add damage of specific types on hand when it comes to toppling specific colossi like the Stunning Beauty .

item.title: BangBang Survivor Codes (July 2024)
item.description:
BangBang Survivor is a mobile survival game where you will defend the base from waves of zombies. By killing them, you will level up and get different abilities and weapon upgrades. Outside of combat, you can also upgrade your weapons and abilities, but this requires plenty of resources. You can get these resources, as well as in-game currency or even new weapons, by redeeming BangBang Survivor codes.

Updated July 16, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: The developers have added several new codes to the game that give you the opportunity to get free rewards. Be sure to use them before they expire.

All BangBang Survivor Codes

Expired BangBang Survivor Codes

At the moment, all codes in BangBang Survivor are active.

How to Redeem Codes in BangBang Survivor

Redeeming codes is usually straightforward in mobile games like BangBang Survivor . Still, we have created a step-by-step guide that explains how to do so.

  • Launch BangBang Survivor and complete the tutorial.
  • Tap on the profile picture in the upper-left corner of the screen.
  • Paste the code into the empty field and press Exchange.

How to Get More BangBang Survivor Codes

To get the latest BangBang Survivor codes, please follow this page, which we update regularly, or visit the BangBang Survivor Facebook page.

BangBang Survivor is available on mobile devices.

item.title: Halo: Covenant Unit Tier List
item.description:
Highlights

  • Covenant aliens in Halo boast unique designs, deep lore, and deadly capabilities for immersive gameplay experiences.
  • Elites, Brutes, and Hunters stand out as the most deadly Covenant units, equipped with powerful weapons and armor.
  • Grunts and Engineers are considered cannon fodder, while Jackals and Skirmishers fall in the middle tier for combat prowess.

A great Sci-Fi universe usually needs some great alien designs, especially when those aliens play a pivotal role in the series' narrative. Thankfully, Halo has some of the best alien designs in all of gaming, with its Covenant antagonists boasting some incredibly unique visual designs, some great gameplay mechanics, and some surprisingly deep lore.

In the current Halo canon, the Covenant is made up of eight different alien species, all of whom have been indoctrinated under one common religion, often referred to as 'The Great Journey.' Led by the Prophets, the Covenant searches the stars for relics left behind by an ancient race known as the Forerunners, and they stop at nothing to ensure that they're the only faction in the galaxy able to wield these mysterious artifacts, bringing them to war with humanity. While all of the Covenant's units are iconic, their capability for violence varies quite heavily between them.

S-Tier Covenant Units in Halo

The Most Deadly Covenant Units

  • Elites (Sangheili)
  • Brutes (Jiralhanae)
  • Hunters (Mgalekgolo)

As mentioned above, the Covenant is home to eight different species, and the three included in this tier are by far the most deadly of the lot. Starting with arguably the most iconic enemy in the Halo franchise, Elites are the glue that holds the Covenant together, at least in the vast majority of Halo entries. Often seen leading a pack of Grunts, Elites are usually equipped with sturdy shields, fierce plasma rifles, and a range of other tools that can quickly kill any standard UNSC soldier, and give a fully-trained Spartan a run for their money. When equipped with stronger armor and a power weapon such as an Energy Sword or Fuel Rod Cannon, Elites become a true force of nature.

Introduced in Halo 2 , the Brutes begin as a secondary threat to the Elites, but take center stage in Halo 3 as one of the primary threats to humanity. Though they often lack shields, Brutes are equipped with heavy armor and weapons that are even deadlier than the Elites' plasma arsenal. Brutes also have a penchant for going into a berserker rage, where they can charge and leap across battlefields and deliver powerful melee attacks.

Hunters should also be considered some of the strongest Covenant units. Though they're technically just a collection of orange worm-like creatures that form a sort of strong symbiosis, Hunters are extremely deadly to humans, wearing full sets of armor that cover most of their flesh, and sporting gigantic Fuel Rod Cannons that can blow apart vehicles with ease.

A-Tier Covenant Units in Halo

Covenant Units That Pack a Punch

  • Jackals (Kig-Yar)
  • Skirmishers (T'vaoan)

Though they can technically be killed quite easily, Jackals are some of the Covenant's more formidable warriors. While less-equipped Jackals wielding a simple Plasma Pistol and a point defense gauntlet can be killed easily, long-range snipers equipped with a Beam Rifle can be extremely dangerous, capable of killing a Spartan with just one well-placed shot. A subspecies of Kig-Yar, Skirmishers are also strong fighters, zipping around the battlefield at high speeds and blocking oncoming fire with small arm-mounted shields.

B-Tier Covenant Units in Halo

Covenant Units That Put Up a Fight

  • Drones (Yanme'e)
  • Prophets (San'Shyuum)

While they can technically be killed with just one accurate shot, the Covenant's Drones are much trickier than they appear. Capable of flying around at high speeds and swarming enemies in great numbers, Drones pose a significant threat to those without heavy armor. Prophets, on the other hand, pose a much lower threat to oncoming attackers, essentially being frail beings stuck in a floating chair. However, those floating chairs are often equipped with some powerful Covenant technology, making them still a sizable threat.

C-Tier Covenant Units in Halo

Covenant Cannon Fodder

  • Grunts (Unggoy)
  • Engineers (Huragok)

At the very bottom of the barrel, Halo 's Grunts are primarily used as cannon fodder ​by the Covenant, being sent in droves to die at the hands of the enemy in an attempt to thin their numbers. Though some Grunts can get a hold of some powerful weapons, and some are willing to sacrifice their lives in an explosive display of zealotry, they can all be killed very easily. Finally, there are the Engineers, who land at the bottom of this list by default as they're simply a support unit for the rest of the Covenant's forces.

item.title: The First Descendant Season Roadmap
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Following the Global Launch of The First Descendant
  • Season 1 Roadmap for The First Descendant
  • Season 2 Roadmap for The First Descendant

Many games will release roadmaps so that their players know what to expect in the future and how long they will need to wait for these features. The First Descendant has already revealed what players can expect for updates following the Global Launch , as well as the months of August and December .

Each season plans on adding a sizable chunk of content, which will help keep players entertained and engaged for the duration of the game's life cycle.

Following the Global Launch of The First Descendant

Before the first official season starts, there are some goodies coming players' way. Players will be familiar with expanding their roster of playable characters, so they can use this experience to unlock a whole new character.

  • New Descendant: Luna
  • New Colossus: Gluttony
  • New Ultimate Descendant: Ultimate Valby
  • New Ultimate Weapon
  • New Skin

One of the first major elements being added to the game before the start of Season 1 will be a new Descendant called Luna. Luna is an NPC and quest giver in the game, which players will be able to encounter and interact with. Luna will not be the only new character, as there will also be an Ultimate variant of the existing Descendant, Valby. Players will also be able to take on a new Colossus that goes by Gluttony and can look forward to the inclusion of a new Ultimate Weapon and Skin.

Season 1 Roadmap for The First Descendant

There will be three updates featured for the first season of the game, which will be named Season 1: Invasion .

  • Season Progression
  • Field Completion
  • New Descendant & Descendant Story
  • New Colossus/Dungeon
  • New Weapon
  • New Skin
  • New Ultimate Descendant

The first thing to note is “Season Progression” and “Field Completion," which are expected to be ways players can engage with the game in new ways. Some descendants have their own special stories to really help build on the lore of the game, such as with the Follow Their Traces quest for Bunny. Players will also be getting another new character and an Ultimate variant, along with a new weapon and skin.

Season 2 Roadmap for The First Descendant

Just like with the first season, the second will offer three updates. The second season will be called Season 2: Ancestor.

  • New Mega Dungeon
  • Utility Companion
  • Season Progression
  • New Descendant & Descendant Story
  • New Colossus/Dungeon
  • New Weapon
  • New Skin
  • New Ultimate Descendant

As with the previous two sections of this guide, players will be getting a new weapon and skin to obtain, as well as a new Descendant and Ultimate variant. Constantly new weapons will help players not get tired of using the same weapon, which at the time is the incredibly powerful Tamer machinegun. However, a whole new feature will come to Season 2 in the form of a Utility Companion. This could be a form of “pet” which is common for MMOs and live service games.

item.title: Once Human: 'Ripple In Spacetime Detected' Explained
item.description:
Once Human provides players with an expansive open environment to explore as they move through the game's main narrative. Depending on the scenario settings players select upon creating their character, they can continue their base-building quest and also combat against other players on the server.

In this survival shooter game, players must do everything possible to escape an onslaught on a planet afflicted by Stardust , which has transformed many common creatures into terrifying Deviations. However, to enhance the gaming experience, the game includes various hidden and secret rifts that players can enter in particular conditions.

What Is 'Ripple In Spacetime Detected' In Once Human?

When exploring different areas on the map, you may frequently see a pop-up notice on your screen that says, " Ripple in Spacetime Detected ." Because the game's tutorial does not fully explain what this warning implies, many players are unsure what it means and what to do if it is displayed.

In Once Human , not everything is visible, and many items are hidden from the player's usual eyesight. To examine these hidden objects, players must utilize the Cradle's Spacetime ability , which allows them to go to another dimension and discover new objects across the open world.

This is where the notification "Ripple in Spacetime Detected" appears, informing the players that something is present in Spacetime in the location where they are now located. Deviations, elite units , and even simple whispers may be hidden in this spacetime.

Most of the time, when you see this message, it is most likely just a whisper left by other users on the server.

Whispers are messages left by other players in certain areas that can only be seen once the players have entered Spacetime.

You should attempt to read as many of these pieces as possible, as players may have left useful comments exposing the whereabouts of some hidden items or deviations. To enter Spacetime, hit Q on your keyboard, which will expose all the hidden items, crates, and posts in the region.

However, if you are lucky enough, you may discover a secret Mystical Crate in the Spacetime. As a result, it is always suggested that you check out Spacetime to ensure that you do not miss out on valuable loot like food or scraps.

Moreover, hidden deviations in spacetime are also rarely discovered. They are often well hidden in their surroundings, requiring you to conduct your own search to locate and defeat them.

It is recommended to check out an area for potential advantages whenever the "Ripple in Spacetime Detected" message appears on your screen.
